newsitem.title: MEXICO: EU '97 steel consumption seen up at 122 mln T.
newsitem.headline: EU '97 steel consumption seen up at 122 mln T.

text.p: European Union steel consumption is seen rising 5.0 million tonnes next year to around 122 million tonnes, the director general of the European Association of Steel Industries, known as Eurofer, said here Tuesday.

Dietrich von Huelsen told the Latin American Steel Congress here in this northern Mexican steel centre that a normalisation of steel inventories and an expected increase in demand as economies improve were behind the forecast five percent rise in consumption.

"Conditions of export markets have improved and also internal demand is recovering. The big problem with the European steel market in the last two years was the accumulation of stocks in the first half of 1995," he said.
He said this caused a drop in prices and lead to a strong fall in deliveries from European producers even though real demand remained stable in both 1995 and 1996.

"Stocks levels are now considered normal, and together with the expected increase in demand in 1997 as economies improve it should be that apparent consumption in the European Union next year will rise by five million tonnes, or five percent, to 122 million tonnes," he added.
